BUTTONS.SUBMIT_RESPONSE_PAYMENT: Submit and continue to payment (£{{ payment }})
BUTTONS.CLOSE_AND_RETURN_TO_CASE_OVERVIEW: Close and return to case overview

STATEMENT_OF_TRUTH.MAKE_CHANGES_NOT_ALLOWED: Once your claim is submitted you will not be able to make any changes. Your claim will not be issued and sent to the other parties until you have paid the claim fee.

YOUR_RESPONSE.HAVE_BEEN_PAID: Have you been paid the £{{ paidAmount }}?

CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.DO_YOU_AGREE_PAID: Do you agree the defendant has paid £{{ paidAmount }}?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.DO_YOU_WANT_TO_SETTLE_PAID: Do you want to settle the claim for the £{{ paidAmount }}?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.DO_YOU_ACCEPT_OR_REJECT_THE_DEFENDANTS_A: Do you accept or reject the defendant's admission?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.DO_YOU_ACCEPT_THE_DEFENDANT_REPAYMENT_PL: Do you accept the defendant repayment plan?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.HAS_THE_DEFENDANT_PAID_SOME_OF_THE_AMOUN: Has the defendant paid some of the amount owed?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.HOW_DO_YOU_WANT_TO_FORMALISE_THE_REPAYME: How do you want to formalise the repayment plan
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.HOW_DO_YOU_WISH_TO_PROCEED: How do you wish to proceed?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.HOW_DO_WANT_TO_FORMALISE_REPAYMENT_PLAN: How do you want to formalise the repayment plan?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.PROCEED_WITH_CLAIM: Do you want to proceed with the claim?
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.WILL_REPAY_IN_INSTALLMENTS: {{ fullName }} will repay £{{ amount }} in instalments of £{{ instalmentAmount }} {{ frequency }}. The first instalment will be paid by {{ instalmentDate }}
CHECK_YOUR_ANSWER.WILL_PAY_BY_PAYMENT_DATE: {{ fullName }} will pay £{{ amount }}, no later than {{ paymentDate }}

CLAIM_TASK_LIST.AFTER_COMPLETE: After you have completed all the actions you will be taken to a page where you can check your answers before submitting.
CLAIM_TASK_LIST.COMPLETED_SECTIONS: You have completed {{ completed }} of {{ total }} sections

CLAIM_SUBMITTED.YOUR_CLAIM_WILL_BE_ISSUED: Your claim will be issued once your Help With Fees application has been confirmed.
CLAIM_SUBMITTED.WE_EMAIL_YOU_IN_5_DAYS: We'll email you within 5 days to confirm this.
CLAIM_SUBMITTED.WILL_HAVE_28_DAYS: will have 28 days to respond to your claim.
CLAIM_SUBMITTED.THEY_CAN_REQUEST_EXTRA_DAYS: They can request up to an extra 28 days if they need it.
CLAIM_SUBMITTED.YOU_CAN_REQUEST_COUNTY_COURT: You can request a County Court Judgment against them if they don't respond by the deadline.
CLAIM_SUBMITTED.IF_DEFENDANT_PAYS_YOU_CONTENT: You need to sign in to your account to tell us you've been paid.

BUNDLES.FIND_BUNDLE_BELOW: You can find the bundle below.
BUNDLES.APPLY_TO_COURT_BEFORE: As the bundle has now been created, you will have to
BUNDLES.APPLY_TO_COURT_AFTER: if you want any new documents you upload to be used at your trial or hearing.
BUNDLES.NEW_DOCUMENT_NOT_INCLUDED: Any new documents you upload will not be included in the main bundle. They will be listed separately below and under 'Documents'.
BUNDLES.UPLOADED_AFTER_DOCUMENTS_BELOW: The documents listed below have been uploaded since the trial bundle was created.

CLAIM_SUMMARY.EVIDENCE_UPLOAD_SUMMARY: Read and save all documents uploaded by the parties involved in the claim. Three weeks before the trial, a bundle will be created containing all submitted documents in one place. You will be told when this is available.
CLAIM_SUMMARY.NOTICE_OF_INTENTION: Intention to rely on hearsay evidence

CLAIMANT_LIFT_BREATHING_SPACE_CHECK_ANSW.PAGE_TITLE: Lift the debt respite scheme (breathing space)

CLAIMANT_LIFT_BREATHING_SPACE_CHECK_ANSW.CYA_HEADER_TEXT: Once the debt respite scheme is lifted you will not be able to change this.

CLAIMANT_INTEREST_RATE.PAGE_TITLE: Annual rate interest you want to claim

COURT_PROPOSED_DATE.BASED_ON: Based on financial details the defendant gave us, we don't believe they can pay by your proposed date.
COURT_PROPOSED_DATE.COURT_CALCULATOR: The court's calculator has determined {{ paymentDate }} as the date when they can pay you in full.
COURT_PROPOSED_DATE.DO_YOU_ACCEPT: Do you accept a repayment date of {{ paymentDate }}?
COURT_PROPOSED_DATE.IF_YOU_WANT_JUDGE: If you want a judge to make a repayment plan, you must still request a judgment for the court’s proposed plan in the next screen
COURT_PROPOSED_DATE.NO_I_WANT_JUDGE: No - I want a judge to make a new repayment plan
COURT_PROPOSED_DATE.PAGE_TITLE: The defendant can’t pay by your proposed date
COURT_PROPOSED_DATE.TITLE: The defendant can’t pay by your proposed date

COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.BASED_ON: Based on the financial details provided by the defendant, we don’t believe they would be able to make these repayments.
COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.COURT_AFFORDABILITY: The court affordability calculator has determined a new repayment plan as the most the defendant can repay.
COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.DO_YOU_ACCEPT: Do you accept the court’s proposed repayment plan?
COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.IF_YOU_WANT_JUDGE: If you want a judge to make a repayment plan, you must still request a judgment for the court’s proposed plan in the next screen
COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.I_WANT_ACCEPT: I want to accept this repayment plan
COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.I_WANT_JUDGE: I want a judge to make a repayment plan
COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.PAGE_TITLE: The defendant can’t afford your plan
COURT_PROPOSED_PLAN.TITLE: The defendant can’t afford your plan

PA_PAY_IMMEDIATELY.DEFENDANT_TO_PAY_YOU_IMMEDIATELY: The defendant said they'll pay you £{{ admittedAmount }} immediately.
PA_PAY_IMMEDIATELY.PAYMENT_BY: They must make sure you have the money by {{ paymentDate }}. Any cheques or transfers should be clear in your account.
PA_PAY_IMMEDIATELY.TELL_US_SETTLEMENT: You need to tell us if you've settled the claim, for example because the defendant has paid you.

RC_DISPUTE.NOT_PROCEED_WITH_CLAIM: You didn't proceed with the claim
RC_DISPUTE.CLAIM_ENDED: The claim has now ended. We've emailed {{ defendantName }} to tell them.

SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.AFTER_REQUESTED: After you've requested a CCJ you can ask the court to enforce payment.
SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.IF_CANT_AFFORD: If they don't think they can afford the plan, they can ask for a judge to make a different plan.
SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.IF_DONT_SIGN: If they don't sign the agreement or reject it, you can request a CCJ against them which orders them to pay in line with the terms of the repayment plan.
SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.IF_SIGNS: If {{ defendantName }} signs the settlement agreement but breaks the terms, you can request a County Court Judgement (CCJ) by signing in to your account.
SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.IF_THEY_SIGN: If they sign the agreement, this claim is put on hold.
SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.THEY_MUST_RESPOND_BEFORE: They must respond before 4pm on {{ respondByDate }}. We'll email you when they respond.
SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.TITLE: You've signed a settlement agreement
SIGN_SETTLEMENT_AGREEMENT.WE_EMAILED: We've emailed {{ defendantName }} the repayment plan and the settlement agreement for them to sign.

YES_MEDIATION.WHAT_HAPPENS_NEXT_TEXT_PARA_1: You agreed to try free mediation.
YES_MEDIATION.WHAT_HAPPENS_NEXT_TEXT_PARA_2: Your mediation appointment will be arranged within 28 days.

NO_MEDIATION.WHAT_HAPPENS_NEXT_TEXT: We'll review the case. We'll contact you to tell you what to do next.

CCJ.CCJ_NEXT_STEP_MSG1: You've requested a County Court Judgment against the defendant.
CCJ.CCJ_NEXT_STEP_MSG2: When we've processed your request we'll post a copy of judgment to you and to {{ defendantName }}.

DETAILS.FIRST_PARAGRAPH: This agreement settles the claim made by {{ claimant }} against {{ defendant }}. This includes all money owed in the claim, for example court fees, expenses or interest.
DETAILS.SECOND_PARAGRAPH: Neither party can make any further claims relating to this case, other than to enforce it.
DETAILS.THIRD_PARAGRAPH: Either party can view and download this agreement from their Money Claims account. Both parties should keep a copy of this agreement.
DETAILS.CLAIMANT_REQUEST_CCJ: The claimant can request a County Court Judgment (CCJ) for any money still owed from this agreement.
DETAILS.AGREEMENT_NOTE: Make sure this agreement includes everything you’ve agreed with {{ defendant }} before signing. You won’t be able to change this later.
DETAILS.CONFIRMATION: I confirm I’ve read and accept the terms of the agreement.

STATUS_CLAIMANT.IN_MEDIATION: Your mediation appointment will be arranged within 28 days
STATUS_CLAIMANT.MEDIATION_SUCCESSFUL: You both agreed a settlement through mediation

STATUS_DEFENDANT.CLAIM_SENT_TO_CLAIMANT: We've sent your offer to the claimant. You have rejected the claim.
STATUS_DEFENDANT.CLAIMANT_ACCEPTED_SETTLE_IN_COURT: The claimant has accepted your offer. You need to sign a legal agreement to settle out of court. You have rejected the claim.
STATUS_DEFENDANT.CLAIMANT_REJECT_OFFER: The claimant has rejected you offer. You have rejected the claim.
STATUS_DEFENDANT.CLAIMANT_REJECT_PARTIAL_ADMISSION: {{ claimantName }} rejected your admission of £{{ amount }}
STATUS_DEFENDANT.IN_MEDIATION: Your mediation appointment will be arranged within 28 days
STATUS_DEFENDANT.MORE_DETAILS_REQUIRED: Send us more details before the hearing
STATUS_DEFENDANT.MEDIATION_SUCCESSFUL: You both agreed a settlement through mediation

DEBT_RESPITE_END_DATE.THIS_IS_THE: This is the end date that it is due to finish (optional)
DEBT_RESPITE_END_DATE.TITLE: Expected end date

DEFENDANT_DETAILS.INVALID_CLAIM: Your claim may be invalid if you use the wrong address.

DETAILS.AGREEMENT_NOTE: Make sure this agreement includes everything you’ve agreed with {{ claimant }} before signing. You won’t be able to change this later.
DETAILS.CHOOSE_NOT_TO_SIGN: You can choose not to sign the settlement agreement, for example if you think you can't afford it.
DETAILS.CLAIMANT_REQUEST_CCJ: The claimant can request a County Court Judgment (CCJ) for any money still owed from this agreement.
DETAILS.FIRST_PARAGRAPH: This agreement settles the claim made by {{ claimant }} against {{ defendant }}. This includes all money owed in the claim, for example court fees, expenses or interest.
DETAILS.NO: No - I reject the terms of the agreement.
DETAILS.ON_HOLD: The claim will be put on hold and the claimant can't request a CCJ against you.
DETAILS.REQUEST_CCJ: The claimant can request a CCJ against you to enforce the repayment plan shown in the agreement. You can ask a judge to change the plan based on your financial details. The court has reviewed the plan and believes you can afford it, so a judge may not change it.
DETAILS.SECOND_PARAGRAPH: Neither party can make any further claims relating to this case, other than to enforce it.
DETAILS.SIGN_THE_AGREEMENT: Do you want to sign the settlement agreement?

THE_AGREEMENT.LABEL: The agreement
THE_AGREEMENT.PAY_BY_SET_DATE: {{ defendant }} will pay £{{ amount }} no later than {{ paymentDate }}.
THE_AGREEMENT.REPAYMENT_PLAN: {{ defendant }} will repay £{{ amount }} in instalments of £{{ paymentAmount }} every {{ theAgreementRepaymentFrequency }}. The first instalment will be paid by {{ firstRepaymentDate }}.

DETAILS.THIRD_PARAGRAPH: Either party can view and download this agreement from their Money Claims account. Both parties should keep a copy of this agreement.
DETAILS.VALID_YES_NO_OPTION: Select Yes - I confirm I have read and accept the terms of the agreement if you want to accept the agreement
DETAILS.YES: Yes - I confirm I've read and accept the terms of the agreement.

ELIGIBILITY_DEFENDANT_ADDRESS.PAGE_TITLE: Defendant Address in England or Wales

ELIGIBILITY_HWF_REFERENCE.ALREADY_APPLIED: You’ll only have one if you’ve already applied for Help with Fees in respect of this claim.
ELIGIBILITY_HWF_REFERENCE.DECIDE: Decide whether to apply for Help with Fees
ELIGIBILITY_HWF_REFERENCE.MAKE_A_NOTE: Make a note of the Help with Fees number when you make an application.
ELIGIBILITY_HWF_REFERENCE.MAKE_CLAIM_USING: and make a claim using a Help with Fees number. If you need to use the paper Help with Fees application rather than the online version then you will not be able to use Online Civil Money Claims to issue your claim.
ELIGIBILITY_HWF_REFERENCE.WHEN_YOU_APPLY: When you apply for Help with Fees you will be asked for the number on your court or tribunal form. Please note that this is N1.
ELIGIBILITY_HWF_REFERENCE.WILL_NEED: You will need this number to make your claim when you are returned to this service.

FEE_CHANGE.TITLE: Claim fee has changed
FEE_CHANGE.PARAGRAPH_1: You submitted a claim, but did not pay the claim fee, so it was not issued and sent to the other parties.
FEE_CHANGE.PARAGRAPH_2: Since then the claim fee has been recalculated and is now £{{ claimFee }}.
FEE_CHANGE.PARAGRAPH_3: To proceed with this claim you need to create a new claim and pay the claim fee.

ACCEPT_REPAYMENT_PLAN.DEFENDANT_OFFERED_TO_PAY: {{ defendantName }} has offered to pay you in full by {{ proposedSetDate }}
ACCEPT_REPAYMENT_PLAN.NO_OPTION_HINT_TEXT: The defendant should have sent you their financial details. You’ll need to send them to us. We’ll issue a CCJ against them. The terms of the CCJ will depend on whether we believe they can afford your suggested repayment plan.

JUDGMENT_AMOUNT.HOW_INTEREST_IS_CALCULATED: Interest calculated as "{{ reason }}" for {{numberOfDays}} days.

LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.CLAIMANT_REJECT_PAYMENT_PLAN_MSG2: The court will review the case. We’ll contact you by post to tell you what to do next.
LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.CLAIMANT_REJECT_PAYMENT_PLAN_MSG3: Your online account won’t be updated - any further updates will be by post.

APPLY_HELP_FEE_SELECTION.LINK_BEFORE: If you're on a low income, have limited savings or are claiming benefits, you may able to get
APPLY_HELP_FEE_SELECTION.LINK_TEXT: help with fees (opens in a new tab).
APPLY_HELP_FEE_SELECTION.PARAGRAPH: If you meet the criteria, you may get support to pay some or all of the fee.
APPLY_HELP_FEE_SELECTION.QUESTION_TITLE: Do you want to apply for help with fees?
APPLY_HELP_FEE_SELECTION.TITLE: Pay hearing fee

UNSUCCESSFUL.NO_MONEY_TAKEN: No money has been taken from your account
UNSUCCESSFUL.PAYMENT_BY_PHONE_PARAGRAPH_1: Make a payment by phone by calling us on 0300 123 7050. Quote your case reference number which is {{ claimId }}.
UNSUCCESSFUL.PAYMENT_BY_PHONE_PARAGRAPH_2: Lines are open from Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5pm.
UNSUCCESSFUL.PAYMENT_BY_PHONE_PARAGRAPH_3_PART_2: find out about call charges (opens in a new tab).
UNSUCCESSFUL.RETURN_TO_CASE_OVERVIEW: Close and return to case overview

TRIAL_HEARING_CONTENT.VIEW_HEARING_NOTICE_BEFORE: You should view the hearing notice under
TRIAL_HEARING_CONTENT.KEEP_CONTACT_DETAILS_UP_TO_DATE: Please keep your contact details and the contact details of anyone you wish to rely on in court up to date. You can update contact details by telephoning the court at 0300 123 7050.

APPLY_HELP_WITH_FEES.LINK: Apply for Help with Fees (open in a new window)
APPLY_HELP_WITH_FEES.PARAGRAPH_IF: If you already have a help with fees reference number in relation to the claim issue fee or any application fees, you should not use this reference number for this application.
APPLY_HELP_WITH_FEES.PARAGRAPH_INSTEAD: Instead, you should make a new help with fees application which will provide you with a new reference number. Note down this number and keep it safe as you will need it later in the process.
APPLY_HELP_WITH_FEES.PARAGRAPH_DURING: During your application, you will be asked for the number of your court or tribunal form. Enter 'hearing fee' followed by short explanation, for example 'hearing fee small claims' or 'hearing fee for fast track'.
APPLY_HELP_WITH_FEES.PARAGRAPH_ONCE: Once you have made your application, return to this page and click continue to proceed.
APPLY_HELP_WITH_FEES.TITLE: Apply for help with fees

VIEW_ORDER.TITLE: An order has been made on your claim
VIEW_ORDER.JUDGE_HAS_MADE_ORDER: The Judge has made an order on your claim.
VIEW_ORDER.ORDER_IS_AVAILABLE: The order is available in 'Notices and orders'.
VIEW_ORDER.KEEP_CONTACT_DETAILS_UP_TO_DATE: Please keep your contact details and the contact details of anyone you wish to rely on in court up to date. You can update contact details by telephoning the court at 0300 123 7050.

FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.TITLE: Finalise your trial arrangements for your upcoming trial
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_THERE_ARE_CHANGES_BEGINNING: If there are changes to your trial arrangements, you should let us know by
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_MAY_WISH_TO_REVIEW: You may wish to review the original directions you supplied in the
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.UNDER_NOTICES_AND_ORDERS: under ‘Notices and orders’ prior to finalising your trial arrangements.

BUNDLE.TITLE: Bundle is complete and ready to view
BUNDLE.BUNDLE_CONTAINS_ALL_DOCUMENTS: The bundle contains all the documents submitted by both parties. Please review the bundle to makes sure all the information is correct.
BUNDLE.YOU_ARE_REMINDED: You are reminded that the other party will also be able to view the bundle.

CASE_DISMISSED_HEARING_DUE_DATE.TITLE: Claim has been struck out
CASE_DISMISSED_HEARING_DUE_DATE.DEFENDANT_WARNING: This claim has been struck out because the claimant has not paid the hearing fee as instructed in the hearing notice. As a result, the hearing scheduled for {{ hearingDate }} at {{ hearingTime }} will no longer take place.
CASE_DISMISSED_HEARING_DUE_DATE.DEFENDANT_PARAGRAPH: If the claimant wants to reinstate this claim, they will need to make an application to the court.

VIEW_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.TITLE_OTHER_PARTY: The other party has finalised their trial arrangements
VIEW_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.TITLE_YOU: You have finalised your trial arrangements
VIEW_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_CAN_VIEW_YOUR_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS: You can view your trial arrangements under 'Notices and orders'.
VIEW_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_CAN_VIEW_OTHER_PARTY: You can view the other party's trial arrangements under 'Notices and orders'.

NEW_UPLOAD.TITLE: New documents have been uploaded
NEW_UPLOAD.NEW_DOCUMENTS: Ahead of your upcoming trial or hearing, new documents have been uploaded. You can view them under 'Documents'.

EVIDENCE_UPLOAD.DOCUMENTS_SUBMITTED_NOT_CONSIDERED: Any documents submitted after the due date may not be considered by the judge.
EVIDENCE_UPLOAD.FOLLOW_INSTRUCTIONS_IN: Please follow the instructions sent in the
EVIDENCE_UPLOAD.FOUND_UNDER_NOTICES_AND_ORDERS: which can be found under 'Notices and orders'.
EVIDENCE_UPLOAD.TITLE: Upload documents
EVIDENCE_UPLOAD.YOU_CAN_UPLOAD_AND_SUBMIT_DOCUMENTS: You can upload and submit any documents which support your claim. These can include any communications, paperwork and statements from expert and witnesses.

LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.IF_MONEY_NOT_RECEIVED_COUNTY_COURT_JUDGE: If they don’t receive the money by then, they can request a County Court Judgment against you.
LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.REJECTED_YOUR_ADMISSION: {{ claimantName }} has rejected your admission of £{{ partAmount }}
LATEST_UPDATE_CONTENT.THEY_BELIEVE_FULL_AMOUNT_CLAIMED: They believe you owe them the full £{{ fullAmount}} claimed.

UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.ANSWERS_TO_QUESTIONS: Answers to questions asked by other party
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.ANSWERS_TO_QUESTIONS_HINT: Your expert's answers to questions put by the other party
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.CHECK_YOUR_ANSWERS_WARNING_FULL:
Warning
You cannot withdraw a document once you have submitted it.
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.CHECK_YOUR_ANSWERS_WARNING_SHORT: You cannot withdraw a document once you have submitted it.
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.CHECK_YOUR_ANSWERS_CORRECT: I confirm the documents are correct, and understand that I cannot withdraw documents once I have submitted them.
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.CHECK_YOUR_ANSWERS_VALIDATION: Tell us if you confirm the documents are correct.
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.COSTS_HINT: A detailed list of the costs you have incurred in making or defending the claim, for example photocopying, getting copies of contracts, include receipts
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DISCLOSURE_LIST_HINT: A list of the documents that you must show the other parties
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTARY_EVIDENCE_HEARING_HINT: Documents that you wish to rely on at the hearing, including emails, receipts, invoices, contracts and photos. You do not need to add documents that you have already added under witness evidence
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTARY_EVIDENCE_TRIAL_HINT: Documents that you wish to rely on at the trial, including emails, receipts, invoices, contracts and photos. You do not need to add documents that you have already added under witness evidence
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTS_FOR_DISCLOSURE_HINT: Recorded information that you must show the other parties - for example, contracts, invoices, receipts, emails, text messages, photos, social media messages
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTS_REFERRED_TO_STATEMENT: Documents referred to in the statement
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTS_REFERRED_TO_STATEMENT_HINT: Documents you or your witness refer to in the statement, including emails, receipts, invoices, contracts and photos
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.EXPERTS_REPORT_HINT: A written report by your expert. Expert evidence is an opinion based on the expertise of a specialist, for example - a building surveyor who can comment on the quality of building work. An expert is not a legal representative
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.JOINT_STATEMENT_OF_EXPERTS_HINT: A statement by the experts for both parties, setting out the facts in the case that they agree on or disagree on. This only applies if you and the other party set up a meeting for your experts. The experts write this statement after their discussion
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.LEGAL_AUTHORITIES_HINT: You can use legal authorities to support your case. These are Acts of Parliament, Rules - for example, the Civil Procedure Rules - or other court cases that have decided a point that is relevant to your case. Copy and paste the relevant extracts from Acts, Rules or cases into a document to upload
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.NOTICE_OF_INTENTION: Notice of intention to rely on hearsay evidence
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.NOTICE_OF_INTENTION_HINT: Notice to tell the other parties that you intend to rely on hearsay evidence at the trail. If the evidence is in a witness statement and the witness is not going to be in court, you must say why
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.QUESTIONS_FOR_OTHER_PARTY: Questions for other party's expert or joint expert
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.QUESTIONS_FOR_OTHER_PARTY_HINT: Written questions about an expert's report or a joint statement of experts
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.SELECT_THE_TYPE_OF_DOCUMENT: Select the types of documents that apply to your case. You may not need to upload documents for every category.
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.SKELETON_ARGUMENT_HINT: Summary of the case, the areas in dispute and the reasons why you think those disputes should be resolved in your favour
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.TITLE: What types of documents do you want to upload?
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.WITNESS_STATEMENT_HINT: A written statement of what your witness wants to tell the court
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.WITNESS_SUMMARY_HINT: If you cannot get a written statement from your witness, you can write a summary of the evidence you would want to include in the witness statement. You must apply to the court to use a witness summary at the hearing. You must do this before the deadline. Use
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.YOUR_STATEMENT_HINT: A written statement of what you want to tell the court

EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS_UPLOADED.TITLE: Documents uploaded
EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS_UPLOADED.UPLOAD_MORE_DOCUMENTS_END: now or come back later. You can view your documents and the other party's documents.

EVIDENCE_UPLOAD_CANCEL.HEADING: Document upload
EVIDENCE_UPLOAD_CANCEL.TITLE: Cancel document upload
EVIDENCE_UPLOAD_CANCEL.WARNING_CANCEL:
Warning
If you cancel, you will lose all unsubmitted information and documents.
EVIDENCE_UPLOAD_CANCEL.ARE_YOU_SURE: Are you sure you want to cancel?

ORGANISATION_DETAILS.MAIN_OFFICE: Enter the organisation’s main office or an organisation’s address that has a connection with the claim.

ABLE_TO_GET_AN_ADVICE.1: You might be able to get advice from organisations like

CLAIM_AGAINST_GOVERNMENT.CANT_USE_SERVICE: You can’t use this service to claim against
CLAIM_AGAINST_GOVERNMENT.COMMA_COMPLETE_RETURN: , complete it and return it to make your claim

DEFENDANT_UNDER_18.CAN_ONLY_USE: You can only use this service to claim against a defendant who’s 18 or over.
DEFENDANT_UNDER_18.MIGHT_ABLE: You might be able to get advice from organisations like

CLAIMANT_UNDER_18.CANT_USE_IF_UNDER_18: You need to be 18 or over to use this service.

REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.BEHIND_ON_TAX_PAYMENTS: Are they behind on tax payments?
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.FULL_ADMISSION: {{ defendant }} admits they owe all the money you’ve claimed.

FULL_ADMISSION_PAY_BY_INSTALLMENTS.DEFENDANT_ADMITS: {{ defendant }} admits they owe you all the money you've claimed. This is the total amount you'll be paid, including the claim fee and interest if applicable.
FULL_ADMISSION_PAY_BY_INSTALLMENTS.THEY_OFFERED_PAY: They've offered to pay you this in instalments.

REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.PART_ADMIT_ALREADY_PAID_STATEMENT: {{ defendant }} said they paid you £{{ paidAmount }}. They said this is all they owe, not the amount you claimed.

PART_ADMIT_NOT_PAID.THEY_OFFERED_TO_PAY_YOU_IMMEDIATELY: They’ve offered to pay you £{{ paidAmount }} immediately. This is the total amount you’ll be paid, including the claim fee and interest if applicable.

REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.PAYMENT_DATE: They’ve offered to pay you this by {{ paymentDate }}
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.TOTAL_PAID_AMOUNT: This is the total amount you’ll be paid, including the claim fee and interest if applicable.
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.WHEN_THEY_SAY_THEY_PAID: When they say they paid this amount?
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.WHY_THEY_DISAGREE_AMOUNT: Why they say they don’t owe the amount you claimed?
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.WHY_THEY_DISAGREE_CLAIM: Why they disagree with the claim?
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.WHY_THEY_DISAGREE_EVIDENCE: Why they disagree with your evidence?
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.WHY_THEY_DISAGREE_TIMELINE: Why they disagree with your timeline?

PART_ADMIT_HOW_THEY_WANT_TO_PAY_RESPONSE.SUGGESTED_REPAYMENT: The defendant suggested this repayment plan

REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.WHEN_THEY_PAID_THIS_AMOUNT: When they say they paid this amount
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.THEY_DONT_OWE_CLAIM_AMOUNT: Why they say they dont owe the amount you claimed?
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.REJECT_CLAIM_PAID_FULL_STATEMENT: {{ defendant }} said they paid you £{{ paidAmount}}.
REVIEW_DEFENDANTS_RESPONSE.REJECT_CLAIM_PAID_LESS_STATEMENT: {{ defendant }} said they paid you £{{ paidAmount}}. They said this is all they owe, not the amount you claim.

SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE.TITLE: Money Claims – GOV.UK
SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE.YOU_WILL_BE_ABLE_LATER: You will be able to use the service later.

SUBMIT_CONFIRMATION.CLAIM_NOT_BE_ISSUED_UNTIL_PAID: Your claim will not be issued and sent to the other parties until you have paid the claim fee.

TOTAL_AMOUNT.HOW_INTEREST_IS_CALCULATED: How interest to date is calculated?
TOTAL_AMOUNT.IF_SUCCESSFUL: If it’s successful, you may not have to pay any or all of the claim fee.
TOTAL_AMOUNT.IF_UNSUCCESSFUL: If it’s unsuccessful, we’ll ask you to pay the claim fee shown on this page in full.
TOTAL_AMOUNT.TOTAL_WOULD_BE_LOWER: That would mean the total claim amount would be lower than the amount shown on this page.
TOTAL_AMOUNT.WE_WILL_REVIEW: We’ll review your Help With Fees application after you submit the claim

FEE_AMOUNT.TITLE: Pay your claim fee
FEE_AMOUNT.MESSAGE: If you settle out of court we won't refund your claim fee. You can ask the defendant to pay back your claim fee as part of the settlement.

TRIAL_DURATION_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.TITLE: Finalise your trial arrangements
TRIAL_DURATION_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.TRIAL_DURATION_PARAGRAPH: The trial duration originally allocated is {{ hearingDuration }}.
TRIAL_DURATION_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.REQUIRE_LESS_TIME: If you require less time please set out your reasons in the 'Other information' box below.
TRIAL_DURATION_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.REQUIRE_MORE_TIME:
If you think you will need more time for the trial, you will need to liaise with the other party and make an application to the court.

The time allocated for the trial will not be increased until an application is received, the fee paid, and an order made.
TRIAL_DURATION_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.OTHER_INFORMATION_INPUT_LABEL: Is there anything else the court needs to know (optional)?
TRIAL_DURATION_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.OTHER_INFORMATION_INPUT_HINT: For example, a witness needs to leave the court by 3pm due to caring responsibilities.

UPLOAD_DOCUMENTS.FORMAT: Each document must be less than 100MB. You can upload the following file types: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, PDF, RTF, TXT, CSV, JPG, JPEG, PNG, BMP, TIF,TIFF.
UPLOAD_DOCUMENTS.NAME: Your name
UPLOAD_DOCUMENTS.SUBTITLE: Acceptable documents formats
UPLOAD_DOCUMENTS.TITLE: Upload documents
UPLOAD_DOCUMENTS.TYPE_OF_DOCUMENT_EXAMPLE: For example, contract, invoice, receipt, email, text message, photo, social media message
UPLOAD_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENT_ISSUE_DATE: Date document was issued or message was sent

WITNESS.DOCUMENT: Documents referred to in the statement
WITNESS.NOTICE: Notice of intention to rely on hearsay evidence
WITNESS.TITLE: Witness evidence
WITNESS.TYPE_OF_DOCUMENT_HINT: For example, contract, invoice, receipt, email, text message, photo, social media message

EXPERT.TITLE: Expert evidence
EXPERT.QUESTIONS_FOR_OTHER: Questions for other party's expert or joint expert
EXPERT.NAME_DOCUMENT_YOU: Name of document you have questions about
EXPERT.ANSWERS_TO_QUESTIONS: Answers to questions asked by other party
EXPERT.NAME_DOCUMENT_WITH: Name of document with other party's questions

IS_CASE_READY.IS_CASE_READY: Is the case ready for trial?
IS_CASE_READY.YOU_ARE_REMINDED: You are reminded that this information will be shared with all other parties
IS_CASE_READY.YOU_WILL_STILL: You will still need to continue and provide some information on trial arrangements.
IS_CASE_READY.YOU_WILL_NEED: You will need to make an application to the court if this case is not ready for the trial.
IS_CASE_READY.THE_TRIAL_OR: The trial will go ahead as planned on the specified date unless a judge makes an order changing the date of the trial. If you want the date of the trial to be changed (or any other order to make the case ready for trial) you will need to make an application to the court.

HAS_ANYTHING_CHANGED.PAGE_TITLE: Has anything changed to the support
HAS_ANYTHING_CHANGED.HAS_ANYTHING: Has anything changed to the support or adjustments you wish the court and the judge to consider for you, or a witness who will give evidence on your behalf?
HAS_ANYTHING_CHANGED.YOU_CAN: You can check your previous answers in the
HAS_ANYTHING_CHANGED.WHAT_SUPPORT: What support do you, experts or witnesses need?
HAS_ANYTHING_CHANGED.FOR_EXAMPLE: For example, a witness requires a courtroom with step-free access.

UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.TITLE: Upload your documents
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.CHECK_THE_ORDER: Check the order the court sent you for what documents you need to upload for your case.
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.YOU_CANNOT_WITHDRAW: You cannot withdraw a document once you have submitted it. If you want to add more information to something you have already submitted, you can upload the document again. You should add a version number to the name, for example 'version2'.
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.THE_OTHER_PARTIES: The other parties will be able to see the documents you have uploaded, and you will be able to see their documents.
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.CHECK_THE_ORDER_DEADLINES: Check the order the court sent you for the deadlines for uploading your documents.
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.AFTER_THE_DEADLINE: After the deadline, you will have to
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.IF_YOU_WANT_ANY: if you want any new document to be used at the trial or hearing.
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.YOU_DO_NOT_HAVE: You do not have to upload all your documents at once. You can return to upload them later.
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.BEFORE_YOU_UPLOAD_THE: Before you upload the document, give it a name that tells the court what it is, for example 'Witness statement by Jane Smith'.

FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.TITLE: Finalise your trial arrangements
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_HAVE_UNTIL_DATE: You have until {{ hearingDueDate }} to provide this information.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_FINALISE: You should finalise your trial arrangements to ensure the court has the necessary information for the trial to proceed in a suitable way.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IS_THE_CASE_READY_FOR_TRIAL: Is the case ready for trial?
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.WE_ARE_ASKING_YOU: We are asking you to confirm the case is ready for the trial. This means you have taken all the action required of you in the
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOUR_CASE_NOT_READY: If your case is not ready and you do not think it will be ready by the deadline for finalising your trial arrangements, you may wish to postpone or adjourn the trial. To do this, you will need to make an application to the court.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOU_NEED_TO_MAKE_APPLICATION: If you need to make an application, you must complete and submit your trial arrangements first.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_ONLY_MAKE_AN_APPLICATION: You should only make an application once this has been completed. There will be a link to make an application once you have finalised your trial arrangements.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOU_MAKE_APPLICATION: If you make an application, please note the trial will go ahead as planned until the application is reviewed by a judge and an order made changing the date of the trial.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_WILL_BE_ASKED: You will be asked to specify if there are any changes to the support or adjustments you previously specified in your
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_REVIEW: You should review this to identify if your circumstances have changed.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.WE_WILL_REMIND_YOU: We will remind you of the time allocated for the trial. If you feel less time is needed, you can specify why in the 'other information' box.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOU_FEEL_THAT: If you feel that more time will be required, you will need to liaise with the other party and make an application to the court.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_ONLY_MAKE_APPLICATION: If you need to make an application, you must complete and submit your trial arrangements first. You should only make an application once this has been completed.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.OTHER_INFORMATION_TEXT: You will be given the opportunity to provide any other information relevant to the trial, for example if any party is only available at a specific time.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.ARE_THERE_ANY_CHANGES: Are there any changes to support with access needs or vulnerability for anyone attending a court hearing?

CONFIRMATION.YOU_SAID_CASE_NOT_READY_FOR_TRIAL_OR_HEA: You have said this case is not ready for trial
CONFIRMATION.YOU_WILL_NEED_TO_CALL: For any changes to accessibility requirements between now and the trial date you will need to call 0300 123 7050.
CONFIRMATION.YOU_CAN_VIEW_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS: You can view your and the other party's trial arrangements under
CONFIRMATION.TRIAL_OR_HEARING_WILL_GO_AHEAD_AS_PLANNE: The trial will go ahead as planned on the specified date unless a judge makes an order changing the date of the trial.
CONFIRMATION.IF_YOU_WANT_THE_DATE_OF_THE_HEARING: If you want the date of the trial to be changed (or any other order to make the case ready for trial) you will need to
CONFIRMATION.TO_THE_COURT_AND_PAY: to the court and pay the appropriate fee.
CONFIRMATION.YOU_SAID_CASE_READY_FOR_TRIAL_OR_HEARING: You have said this case is ready for trial
CONFIRMATION.IF_THERE_ARE_ANY_CHANGES_TO_THE_ARRANGEM: If there are any changes to the arrangements between now and the trial date you will need to
CONFIRMATION.AS_SOON_AS_POSSIBLE_AND_PAY: as soon as possible and pay the appropriate fee.
CONFIRMATION.YOU_WILL_NEED_TO_PHONE: For any changes to accessibility requirements between now and the trial date you will need to phone the court on 0300 123 7050.

CONFIRMATION_PAGE.TITLE: Confirmation of your hearing fee payment
CONFIRMATION_PAGE.CONFIRMATION_TITLE.HEARING: Your application for help with the hearing fee is complete
CONFIRMATION_PAGE.YOU_WILL_RECEIVE: You'll receive a decision on your application within 5 to 10 working days.

ERRORS.ACCEPT_REPAYMENT_PLAN: Select I want to accept this repayment plan to accept the court's proposed repayment plan
ERRORS.CLAIM_SUBMITTED_ADVICE_REQUIRED: Please select: Once your claim is submitted you will not be able to make any changes. Your claim will not be issued and sent to the other parties until you have paid the claim fee.
ERRORS.CLAIMANT_ACCEPT_TERMS_OF_THE_AGREEMENT: Please select I confirm I’ve read and accept the terms of the agreement
ERRORS.DIRECTION_QUESTIONNAIRE_REQUIRED_MESSAGE: Tell us if you believe the hearing requirement details on this page are true
ERRORS.FULL_NAME_TOO_LONG: Full name must be no longer than 70 characters
ERRORS.JOB_TITLE_TOO_LONG: Job title must be no longer than 70 characters
ERRORS.ADDRESS_LINE_TOO_MANY: Each address line must be no longer than 50 characters
ERRORS.TOWN_CITY_TOO_MANY: Town or City must be no longer than 50 characters
ERRORS.ADDRESS_LINE_TOO_MANY_CORRESPONDENCE: Each address line must be no longer than 50 characters
ERRORS.TOWN_CITY_TOO_MANY_CORRESPONDENCE: Town or City must no longer than 50 characters
ERRORS.VALID_YES_OR_NO_OPTION: Select Yes to settle the claim
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_TYPE_OF_DOCUMENT: You must enter type of document
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_WITNESS_NAME: You must enter name of witness
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_EXPERT_NAMES: You must enter the name of at least one expert
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_EXPERTISE: You must enter field of expertise
ERRORS.VALID_SELECT_OTHER_PARTY: Select the name of the other party
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_DOCUMENT_QUESTIONS: Enter name of the document you have questions about
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_DOCUMENT_QUESTIONS_OTHER_PAR: Enter name of the document with other party’s questions
ERRORS.VALID_CHOOSE_THE_FILE: Choose the file you want to upload
ERRORS.VALID_MIME_TYPE_FILE: Document must be Word, Excel, PowerPoint, PDF, RTF, TXT, CSV, JPG, JPEG, PNG, BMP, TIF, TIFF
ERRORS.CLAIMANT_REJECTION_RESPONSE_REQUIRED: Enter why you rejected repayment plan
ERRORS.VALID_DATE_OF_DOC_MUST_INCLUDE_DAY: Date of document must include a day
ERRORS.VALID_DATE_OF_DOC_MUST_INCLUDE_MONTH: Date of document must include a month
ERRORS.VALID_DATE_OF_DOC_MUST_INCLUDE_YEAR: Date of document must include a year
ERRORS.VALID_REAL_DAY: Day of Date must be a valid day
ERRORS.VALID_REAL_MONTH: Month of Date must be a valid month
ERRORS.VALID_REAL_YEAR: Year of Date must be a valid year
ERRORS.VALID_DATE_NOT_FUTURE: Date of document must be today or in the past
ERRORS.VALID_YOU_MUST_ENTER_DOI: Enter the date the document was issued or message was sent
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_SUPPORT: Enter the support requirements you, your experts or witnesses need
